forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely before 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West wind 14 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 45. Northwest wind 2 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, one might find a mix of fleeting sunlight and shadows, as rain showers lingered in the early hours, giving way to partly sunny skies. The temperature hovers close to 58 degrees, gradually dipping to around 54 as the afternoon draws on. An invigorating west wind blows steadily, carrying with it the scent of the sea and the promise of seasonal change. While the clouds may part occasionally, they leave in their wake a trace of moisture that keeps the air crisp and cool, a reminder of the earlier rain. 

As evening approaches, expect the sky to dusk into a blanket of partly cloudy tranquility, with temperatures settling around a brisk 45 degrees. The presentation of urban life unfolds differently on days like this—though the sunlight is hesitant, the city retains its charm. It’s an ideal time to bundle up in a soft sweater or a light jacket, perhaps pairing it with a scarf to fend off the cool breeze. Consider a leisurely stroll along the waterfront, where the rhythms of the city blend with the lull of the bay, or indulge in the simple comfort of a favorite café, savoring a warming drink while observing the world drift slowly by.
